meanings.definition: The activities or behavior of bandits.
meanings.sent1: The banditries in the old western movies always involved stealing from innocent people.
meanings.sent2: The police were able to put an end to the banditries in the area by increasing patrols.
meanings.sent3: The banditries in the story were so predictable, it was almost comical.
meanings.sent4: The banditries of corruption were like a dark cloud hanging over the town.
meanings.sent5: The banditries of the outlaws left a trail of fear and destruction in their wake.

meanings.definition: The practice of engaging in criminal activities as a member of a bandit group.
meanings.sent1: The banditries of the gang were finally brought to justice by the authorities.
meanings.sent2: Engaging in banditries is not only illegal but also harmful to society.
meanings.sent3: The banditries of the thieves were so blatant, it was almost laughable.
meanings.sent4: The banditries of the underworld were like a shadowy underworld of crime.
meanings.sent5: The banditries of the robbers were as stealthy as a cat in the night.
